feed.title: Windhawk Mod Updates
feed.subtitle: Updates in the official collection of Windhawk mods

entry.title: Windows 11 Start Menu Styler 1.2.1
entry.content:
• Added themes: 21996, Down Aero, UniMenu.
  • Updated themes: NoRecommendedSection, TranslucentStartMenu.
  • Added support for styling the Windows 10 search menu.
  • Added support for styling the offline variant of the search menu (when the DisableSearchBoxSuggestions registry option is enabled).
  • Fixed the All Apps list sometimes becoming truncated.
  • Empty visual states can now be targeted, can be useful in cases when there's no active visual state.
  • Fixed not being able to style some elements due to error 802B000A (failed to create a 'System.Type' from the text).

entry.title: CEF/Spotify Tweaks 0.6
entry.content:
• Add support for Spotify 1.2.55 and 1.2.56
  • Support directly enabling transparent web content rendering without having to patch Spotify.exe manually
  • Add options to disable forced dark mode or force-enable Chrome extension support
  • Add a JavaScript API for interacting with this mod or the main window that can be used within Spicetify extensions and themes

entry.title: Taskbar on top for Windows 11 1.1
entry.content:
• Added an option to show running indicators above the taskbar icons.
  • Fixed context menus not appearing with monitors that are arranged vertically, one above the other.

entry.title: Classic Start Menu Folders Icon 1.0
entry.content:
Classic Start Menu Folders Icon

Changes the default icon of Start Menu folders that was used in Windows XP and before.

NOTE: This mod doesn't change the icon of Windows 10/11 Start Menu. Open-Shell was used for the screenshot.

entry.title: Vertical Taskbar for Windows 11 1.3.2
entry.content: • Show the running indicator on the right instead of the left when the taskbar is on the right.

entry.title: Vertical Taskbar for Windows 11 1.3.1
entry.content:

entry.title: Alt+Tab window delayer 1.0.0
entry.content:
Alt tab window delayer

This mod improves the Alt+Tab behavior by introducing a short delay before displaying the tasks window. It helps reduce visual distractions by preventing brief flickers when quickly switching between apps, similar to how macOS and Ubuntu handle fast app switching.
